com.ethercis.servicemanager.cluster

Class ClusterInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ethercis.servicemanager.cluster.ClusterInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I_Info, I_Service
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummyConsumer, DummyProvider, DummyService2

    public abstract class ClusterInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements I_Service, I_Info
    Helper Class to ease setting up a service.

    A service can be simply implemented by extending this class logonservice follows: 

     
 public class DummyService extends ClusterInfo implements DummyConsumerMXBean {
 private ClusterController glob;
 private String ME = "DummyConsumer";
 
 public void shutdown() {
        ...     
 }
  
  public String getType() {
        return ME;
  }
  
  public String getVersion() {
        return "1.0";
  }
  
  protected void doInit(ClusterController global, ServiceInfo serviceInfo)
                throws SoaBaseException {
        this.glob = global;
        //add JMX details...
        putObject(I_Info.JMX_PREFIX+"DummyService", this);
        ... do something else
  }
 }

        public ClusterInfo()
        Implicit constructor. Should be OK for most services

      • ClusterInfo

        public ClusterInfo(ClusterController otherGlobal,
                   I_Info additionalInfo)
            throws ServiceManagerException
        Additional infos are added on top of the initial Global configuration.
        Parameters:
        otherGlobal - can not be null.
        additionalInfo - can be null. If not null, these properties will be added on top of the already set in global.
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException

      • setStrippedHostname

        public static java.lang.String setStrippedHostname(I_Info info,
                                                   int chCase)
        Convenience to allow the usage of a name mapped to the hostname which can be used logonservice an identifier in a database. Specifically used for the prefix in the replication.
        Parameters:
        info - can be null, in which case only system properties are changed.

      • loadService

        public static java.lang.Object loadService(I_Info info,
                                           java.lang.String serviceClassName,
                                           java.lang.String registryName)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks in the registry if such an object exists and if not it creates one for you and initializes it.
        Parameters:
        info - The info object to use.
        serviceClassName - The complete name of the service to load.
        registryName - The name to search in the registry for this instance. The registry will be in the info object passed. If you specify null, the lookup is skipped.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws ServiceManagerException
        Description copied from interface: I_Service
        Cleans up the resource.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface I_Service
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException - if an exception occurs. The exception is handled by the RunLevelManager depending on how the service has been configured with the action:

        <action do='STOP' onShutdownRunlevel='2' sequence='5' onFail='resource.configuration.serviceFailed'> If onFail is defined to something, the RunLevelManager will stop.

      • getRegisteredService

        public static <IF extends I_Service> IF getRegisteredService(ClusterController c,
                                                             java.lang.String name,
                                                             java.lang.String version,
                                                             java.lang.Object... parms)
                                                      throws ServiceManagerException
        returns the interface to a defined service in the registry.

        For example:

        I_Dummy mydummyIF = ServiceGetter.get(global, "DUMMY", "1.0");

        Parameters:
        name -
        version -
        parms - optional parameters (provisional for specifying service location f.ex.)
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException
